title: Masterclass series with Refinitiv
complete_body:
Together with Refinitiv, Treasury Today Group is thrilled to announce our new Masterclass series Managing modern risk and regulation: how to expect the unexpected.

Managing modern risk and regulation: how to expect the unexpected

This is a four-part exclusive Masterclass series which will cover:

  • How to expect the unexpected – what you can learn from this series.

  • How to stay on track with LIBOR transition.

  • FX/risk markets.

  • Looking ahead.

Session 1: How to expect the unexpected – what you can learn from this series (18 mins)

Hosted by Andrew Hollins, Director of Corporate Treasury, Refinitiv and Mike Dolan, Editor-at-Large for Finance & Markets, Reuters

This session provides an introduction to the series and sets the context within the frame of recent events such as the COVID-19 pandemic and Brexit, risks that companies are now exposed to. It emphasises how important real-time information is for treasurers as they seek to stress-test and mitigate against all possible scenarios.

Watch video

Session 2: How to stay on track with LIBOR transition (9 mins)

Hosted by Jacob Rank-Broadley, Head of LIBOR transition, Refinitiv

There is increasing pressure for treasury teams to stay abreast of regulations and guidance such as IFRS9, MiFID II and Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) transfer pricing. In addition, the deadline for LIBOR transition towards alternative reference rates and benchmarks is fast approaching. This session identifies and manages the transition of contracts and financial instruments that reference LIBOR and what will be a key priority for corporate treasurers.

Watch video

Session 3: FX/risk markets (10 mins)

Hosted by Alex Goraieb, FX Trading Desktop – Customer Proposition, Refinitiv

Corporate treasurers now depend on the electronification of trading operations – such as foreign exchange and leveraging digital channels – in order to become more resilient to shocks as well as being able to manage workflow remotely. FX electronification must be underpinned by sound data. Find out in this session how this manifests in practice.

Watch video

Session 4: Looking ahead (17 mins)

Hosted by Andrew Hollins, Director of Corporate Treasury, Refinitiv and Sonia Clifton-Bligh, Johnson and Johnson

After the past three chapters of this Masterclass and the broader lessons of the pandemic, one thing is clear, treasurers need quality, actionable data to meet the variety of challenges. Corporate finance professionals must be prepared to expect the unexpected and in order to do that need to arm themselves with information. In conversation with Refinitiv and Sonia Clifton-Bligh, we look at forward trends in the market as well as looking ahead to trends for 2022.

Watch video

Refinitiv Corporate Treasury data, insights and solutions

As a leading financial markets data provider, Refinitiv is an essential partner for corporate treasurers. Our global, multi-asset and multi-jurisdiction view of risk, credit and economic data enable treasury teams to drive stability by managing the global and interconnected nature of risk today. Find out more about Refinitiv corporate treasury data and solutions.

title: Masterclass: Digital Leadership in Treasury
complete_body:
Treasury Today Group is very excited to announce the latest Masterclass series ‘Digital Leadership in Treasury’ in partnership with Citi.

Throughout this series, hear from Citi experts who will guide you through the fundamentals of digital leadership in treasury, giving you the confidence to move forward with your digital strategy.

This Masterclass is based on four sessions which cover the following topics:

  • Session 1 – How to develop a digital strategy for treasury

  • Session 2 – Cutting through the data fog

  • Session 3 – Real-time treasury

  • Session 4 – What's next? Practical steps towards digital treasury

Session 1 – How to develop a digital strategy for treasury (11 mins)

Hosted by Ron Chakravarti, Managing Director, Treasury and Trade Solutions, Client Advisory and Anton Abraham, Principal, Treasury and Trade Solutions Client Advisory, Asia Pacific, Citi.

This session will include an introduction into the Masterclass series and provide key pointers on how to develop a digital strategy for treasury.

Watch video

Session 2 – Cutting through the data fog (10 mins)

Hosted by Joseph Vasen and Duncan Cole, Principals, Client Advisory, Treasury & Trade Solutions, Citi

This session will discuss the importance of data in the domain of corporate treasury and why data is a foundational element to intelligent automation and predictive analysis.

Watch video

Session 3 – Real-time treasury (10 mins)

Hosted by Will Artingstall, Emerging Payments and Business Development Director and Joseph Vasen, Principal, Client Advisory, Treasury and Trade Solutions, Citi.

The session will discuss the definition of real-time treasury and the evolution of treasury practices whilst giving advice on what Treasurers should be thinking about in real-time treasury space.

Watch video

Session 4 – What’s next? Practical steps towards digital treasury (38 mins)

Hosted by Ron Chakravati, Will Artingstall, Anton Abraham and Duncan Cole, Treasury and Trade Solutions, Citi.

Listen back as our hosts provide a recap of the whole Masterclass series and examine the practical steps within digital treasury that treasurers can put into action.

Watch video

title: Disruptors in Cash Masterclass series
complete_body:
Treasury Today Group is delighted to announce our new Disruptors in Cash Masterclass series in partnership with State Street Global Advisors. This Masterclass series will include topics that are considered to be the biggest disruptors in the cash asset class. So listen in and find out how we can help you.

This is a four-part exclusive Masterclass series which will cover the following topics:

  • Cash Alternatives.

  • Integrating ESG in Cash Portfolios.

  • The Future of US and European Prime Funds Strategies.

  • Impacts of Technology in Cash – LIVE SESSION.

Session 1 – Cash Alternatives (10 mins)

Hosted by Will Goldthwait, Senior Portfolio Strategist, State Street Global Advisors.

This session includes an introduction into the Masterclass series. This discussion features cash alternatives and your options, strategies you can use and how best to lever cash performance.

Watch video

Session 2 – Integrating ESG into Cash Portfolios (10 mins)

Hosted by Karyn Corridan, Senior Portfolio Manager, State Street Global Advisors.

In this session you can find out how State Street Global Advisors incorporates ESG into cash strategies.

Download white paper

Watch video

Session 3 – The Future of US and European Prime Funds Strategies (10 mins)

Will Goldthwait, Senior Portfolio Strategist is joined by Sean Lussier, Senior Portfolio Manager, Pia McCusker, Head of Global Cash Management and Kim Hochfeld, Head of Global Cash Business, State Street Global Advisors.

In this session the events of 2020 and the potential for further reform on the US and European registered funds are discussed.

Watch video

Session 4 – Impacts of Technology on Cash (35 mins)

Hosted by Swen Werner, Managing Director & Global Product Manager, State Street Digital, Nicole Olson, Beralda Kokoshi and Ekene Uzoma, Vice Presidents from the Digital Production Development and Innovation Team at State Street.

Join our hosts who will give an overview of the key concepts of blockchain, explain how digital assets could impact the future of markets and provide an overview of key initiatives underway. It will also give you an opportunity to ask questions in a LIVE Q&A session and engage with SMEs to understand better the relevance of digital assets.

Watch video

title: J.P. Morgan ESG Masterclass Series
complete_body:
Together with J.P. Morgan, Treasury Today Group is excited to launch our ESG Masterclass series for 2021, giving you the knowledge, tools and practical insight to confidently build and measure a robust ESG strategy.

This is a four-part exclusive masterclass series which will cover the following topics:

  • ESG in 2021 - the challenges and opportunities.

  • How to qualify for ESG trade finance today.

  • Welcome to the future of sustainable trade with Bridgestone.

  • Success criteria: how to monitor and audit sustainability efforts.

Session 1 – ESG in 2021: the challenges and opportunities (16 mins)

Hosted by Natasha Condon, Global Head, Core Trade, J.P. Morgan.

title: Masterclass Series: Leadership in and after 2020 with India Gary-Martin
complete_body:
Treasury Today Group is very excited to announce the launch of our first Masterclass with a very special guest tutor.

One of the 50 top businesswomen in Europe and Top 100 Black Executives in the UK, India Gary-Martin is an international business, leadership and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion expert who has worked in Germany, Tokyo, Hong Kong and London. She has held several global C-Suite roles, works as a consultant with the leadership of several FORTUNE 100 companies, is a FORBES Council Coach, a former adjunct professor at Temple University and is on the coaching faculty of the New York City Bar Association’s Leadership Institute. For more information visit https://www.leadershipforexecs.com/

Join her for:

Leadership - in & after 2020 with INDIA GARY-MARTIN

A four-part exclusive masterclass series which will equip you with the tools and context required to lead and learn, in and after 2020. Some of the topics covered are:

  • Leading in a crisis

  • Racial equity

  • Effectively managing remote teams

  • Trust

This is a rare and special opportunity to gain leadership skills from one of the world’s leading consultants, coaches and general rockstars, India Gary-Martin.


Masterclass: Lesson one – Leading through a crisis

India’s first Masterclass is available now on demand. This launches the series and will offer you practical and implementable guidance around leadership in a time of crisis.

Register to watch


Masterclass: Lesson two – Racial Equity

India’s second Masterclass live-streamed on Tuesday 10th November, and is now available to watch on-demand.

Register to watch


Masterclass: Lesson three – Effectively Managing Remote Teams

During this episode you will learn the following:

  • The evolution of remote team work

  • Do(s) and Don’t (s) for leaders

  • Managing and motivating remotely

  • Planning for the future

Register to watch


Masterclass: Lesson four - Trust

India’s fourth and final Masterclass live-streamed on Tuesday 1st December, and is now available to watch on-demand.

This episode focuses on the critical ownership of trust that leaders must navigate. You will learn the following:

  • How to build and maintain trust during uncertainty

  • Managing trust internally when there are external factors that drive lack of trust.

  • Rebuilding lost trust remotely

Register to watch
